min_version.description: Minimum version of objdiff required to load this configuration file.

custom_make.description:
By default, objdiff will use make to build the project.
If the project uses a different build system (e.g. ninja), specify it here.
The build command will be `[custom_make] [custom_args] path/to/object.o`.

custom_args.description: Additional arguments to pass to the build command prior to the object path.

target_dir.description:
Relative from the root of the project, this where the "target" or "expected" objects are located.
These are the intended result of the match.

base_dir.description:
Relative from the root of the project, this is where the "base" or "actual" objects are located.
These are objects built from the current source code.

build_target.description:
If true, objdiff will tell the build system to build the target objects before diffing (e.g. `make path/to/target.o`).
This is useful if the target objects are not built by default or can change based on project configuration or edits to assembly files.
Requires the build system to be configured properly.

build_base.description:
If true, objdiff will tell the build system to build the base objects before diffing (e.g. `make path/to/base.o`).
It's unlikely you'll want to disable this, unless you're using an external tool to rebuild the base object on source file changes.

watch_patterns.description:
List of glob patterns to watch for changes in the project.
If any of these files change, objdiff will automatically rebuild the objects and re-compare them.
Supported syntax: https://docs.rs/globset/latest/globset/#syntax

ignore_patterns.description:
List of glob patterns to explicitly ignore when watching for changes.
Files matching these patterns will not trigger a rebuild.
Supported syntax: https://docs.rs/globset/latest/globset/#syntax

units.description: If specified, objdiff will display a list of objects in the sidebar for easy navigation.

progress_categories.description: Progress categories used for objdiff-cli report.

name.description: The name of the object in the UI. If not specified, the object's path will be used.

path.description:
Relative path to the object from the target_dir and base_dir.
Requires target_dir and base_dir to be specified.

target_path.description:
Path to the target object from the project root.
Required if path is not specified.

base_path.description:
Path to the base object from the project root.
Required if path is not specified.

reverse_fn_order.description:
Displays function symbols in reversed order.
Used to support MWCC's -inline deferred option, which reverses the order of functions in the object file.

complete.description:
Marks the object as "complete" (or "linked") in the object list.
This is useful for marking objects that are fully decompiled. A value of `false` will mark the object as "incomplete".

symbol_mappings.description: Manual symbol mappings from target to base.

scratch.description: If present, objdiff will display a button to create a decomp.me scratch.

platform.description: The decomp.me platform ID to use for the scratch.

compiler.description: The decomp.me compiler ID to use for the scratch.

c_flags.description: C flags to use for the scratch. Exclude any include paths.

ctx_path.description: Path to the context file to use for the scratch.

build_ctx.description: If true, objdiff will run the build command with the context file as an argument to generate it.

preset_id.description:
The decomp.me preset ID to use for the scratch.
Compiler and flags in the config will take precedence over the preset, but the preset is useful for organizational purposes.

complete.description:
Marks the object as "complete" (or "linked") in the object list.
This is useful for marking objects that are fully decompiled. A value of `false` will mark the object as "incomplete".

reverse_fn_order.description:
Displays function symbols in reversed order.
Used to support MWCC's -inline deferred option, which reverses the order of functions in the object file.

source_path.description: Path to the source file that generated the object.

progress_categories.description: Progress categories used for objdiff-cli report.

items.description: Unique identifier for the category. (See progress_categories)

auto_generated.description: Hides the object from the object list by default, but still includes it in reports.
